When everyday hatred turns to racist murder: 'I don't know why I lost it. I have no idea'
subhead: On May 31, Christophe Belgembe, a mechanic, fatally shot his neighbor Hichem Miraoui and tried to kill five other people in the southern French town of Puget-sur-Argens. Though he had made racist remarks for years, he struggled to explain his actions.
byline: By Lorraine de Foucher  and Jérôme Lefilliâtre

title: Charlie Kirk shooting: What we know about Tyler Robinson, the suspect arrested on Friday
byline: Le Monde with AP and AFP

title: Fitch downgrades France's credit rating
Israeli intelligence admits Iran's nuclear program has not been destroyed
subhead: Israeli officials have recently provided French authorities with their own assessment of the airstrikes that targeted Tehran's nuclear arsenal in June. This information is particularly valuable to France after American intelligence agencies have halted all cooperation with their European partners regarding the Iranian nuclear program.

title: Nigerian billionaire Aliko Dangote, Africa's wealthiest man, to build one of the continent's largest fertilizer plants in Ethiopia
subhead: For Ethiopia, where agriculture is vital, the new plant is set to improve food security and the country's balance of payments.

title: Australia's costly migration policy
subhead: The country has signed a memorandum of understanding with Nauru, a Pacific island nation, to send foreign nationals whose visas have been revoked on morality or conduct grounds. Canberra could spend up to €1.4 billion over 30 years.

title: In devastated Kathmandu, young Nepalese fear old leaders' return
subhead: No seat of power was spared in Nepal's capital during two days of unprecedented protest. The army, which has seized control of the country, is negotiating a way out of the crisis after the prime minister resigned and the president disappeared. Yet the young people behind the movement have little say in what comes next.

title: From a Thai holiday to a Turkish prison: How two women were trapped by drug traffickers
subhead: The two 20-year-old women from the Paris region enjoyed an all-expenses-paid holiday in Thailand, then given suitcases packed with cannabis before their flight home. Their lawyers argued it was a case of 'great naivety.'

title: Hyundai and LG's giant US plant in shock after massive immigration raid
subhead: The South Korean companies' metaplant in Georgia was the target of a vast federal immigration raid on September 4, during which 475 people were detained.

title: France's 'Block Everything' protests converge around ousting Macron
subhead: Although France did not come to a standstill or grind to a halt on Wednesday, numerous protests took place throughout the day across the country with large gatherings in certain cities – with headcounts between 197,000 and 250,000 people – amid the firm presence of law enforcement.
byline: By Thibaud Métais (with Le Monde's correspondents and reporters)
